title: Champion Concept: Aleksis, the Sanguine Witch
body:
** Updated as of 6:29pm 10/02/15**


**Champion Concept: **Aleksis, the Sanguine Witch 
**Role: ** Mage / Marksman

*~~If this concept is well received by the community, I'll definitely spend some more time working out the specifics of her abilities, such as the health costs, range, flat damage, scalings, etc. But until then, here is my very basic concept of Aleksis, the Sanguine Witch!~~ I'll do it anyway.
*

**Currently revising:**
- Whether or not the increase in attack speed and range should be in relation to nearby infected targets, or level of Plasma Control ability.
- Sanguine Ritual does damage based on ability power/attack damage/health, or damage based on the stacks of Plasma Infection.
- Changing the Plasma Infection stacks to have a timer for all the stacks, instead of slowly ticking down stack by stack.

**Statistics**

Health: 550 - 1810
Health Regen (Health per 5): 6.0 - 16.2
Attack Range: 525
Attack Damage: 50 - 100
Attack Speed: 0.658 (+0% - 40.0%)
Armor: 20
Magic Resist: 35
Movement Speed: 330

 

**Resource:**
Aleksis uses her health as the resource (like Vladimir), rather than mana, energy, rage, etc.

Attack Animation: Throws blood needles (similar to acupuncture needles).

**Passive - Blood Knowledge**
Aleksis' knowledge of blood gives her a bonus to Lifesteal/Spellvamp effects (doesn't get the bonus without items that give those effects). Lifesteal/Spellvamp effects used against Aleksis are slightly decreased. Every 6th auto attack on an enemy champion gives her a small percent of health back based on the enemy's current HP.

**Q - Blood Spike**
Small AoE skill shot ability with short range (*think of Karthus*)
If Blood Spike kills a champion, the range is temporarily increased (3/4/5/6/7 seconds) and the cooldown (15/13/11/9/8) is reset. Blood Spike does extra damage based on the amount of Plasma Infection stacks. If a champion is killed with Blood Spike, the Plasma Infection is spread to nearby champions within a certain radius for the same amount of stacks on death. 

Blood Spike does 20/35/50/80/100 (+100% AP) magic damage.

Blood Spike does 10/20/30/40/50 magic damage per Plasma Infection stack, and remove all stacks once used.

(Note: *This ability isn't meant to be a hard hitting ability on its own. If an opponent is careless and gains significant stacks of Plasma Infection, then the damage will be significantly more as a consequence*).

**W - Plasma Control** 
Passive - Attack speed and attack range increase with the amount of Plasma Infection stacks near her.
Active - Draining health per auto attack allows for an on-hit debuff (caps at 25) called 'Plasma Infection'. This ability does 30 attack damage (+70% AD) on hit.

5 stacks - Blood Spike cooldown reset (When ability is used) and health cost negated.
10 stacks - Inflicts Grievous Wounds.
20 stacks - Reduces armour and magic resist by 10%
Each stack lasts for 3/4/5/6/7 seconds and is refreshed by additional auto attacks and abilities.


**E - Hemo-Transfer **
 Aleksis quickly implodes into a floating body of blood, moving herself towards a direction before reanimating herself from the blood. Cost: HP  - Does no damage. Can be used up to 2 times within the first 3 seconds of activation. (**To clarify** Distance is intended to be short range, enough to dodge a thin skillshot, but shorter in distance than most movement abilities). Untargetable during the quick blink, but can still be damaged by auto attacks. Can be hit by abilities directly before and after the blink (see: Tristana rocket jump)

Cooldown: 25/23/20

**R - Sanguine Ritual **
Target cannot be attacked by opposing players except for Aleksis (4/5/6 seconds). Deals 100/200/300 (+50% ability power) on use, and gives the target the 'Sanguine Haemorrhage' debuff, which burns the target's HP down depending on the distance they travel (the debuff shows how much health is going to be lost over time). The target leaves a visible trail of blood.

Level 1 damage cap: Deals 75 bonus true damage over 4 seconds.
Level 2 damage cap: Deals up to 125 bonus over 5 seconds.
Level 3 damage cap: Deals up to 225 bonus over 6 seconds.

Every 150 units the target champion moves, the target loses 2.5% of their maximum health.

Damage ticks are decided by every 150 units the target moves.

Lasts for 4/5/6 seconds.

Cooldown: 120/100/80

Art:

I added a basic drawing I did of Aleksis - **please keep in mind I don't draw**, but I wanted to give people a basic idea of what she looked like.

Coming Soon.

Aleksis' ultimate is somewhat close to Bloodseeker's ultimate in Dota2...

Still, I like the idea, cuz you can have a ton of synergy with knock back champions, like Lee Sin for example, forcing them to 'move' to take more damage or something like a Blitzcrank grab, also forcing 'movement'

You got me ;) .. But seriously, people are getting tired of champions they feel don't bring something new or introduce some new mechanics and that's something I really wanted to do with this concept. I really enjoy playing complex champions, and it's so great to finally master a champion that takes a while to get proficient with.

Hextech would seem core since this

>Aleksis' knowledge of blood gives her a bonus to Lifesteal/Spellvamp effects

Ouch, that downvote though.

Yeah she is pretty complicated (but compared to other MOBAs she's not that complicated hahah) for a LoL champion I guess. You can build AP, AD, or both. With AD you'd focus on auto-attack and using your Q to poke them down (lifesteal items would be important). With AP you'd cycle between poking with your auto-attack and using your Q to do some decent damage.

E should have a 30 second cd at lvl 1 scaling down to 24-20 at lvl 5 maybe change it to just one and it makes her un-targetable(veigar yasuo vi ult etc) for 2-4 seconds after cast and blinks only once but she can still take damage from auto attacks and skill shots after the blink

>(doesn't get the bonus without items that give those effects)

Rune's and masterys give Lifesteal and Spellvamp, do they gain bonuses?

The bonus would be on additional LS/SV stats so yes there would be. However, I'm considering changing the passive so you get extra health every 6 auto attacks based on your lifesteal/spellvamp because having a scaling bonus on those stats could be useless or overpowered.

Pretty underpowered, her Spellvamp is already worthless (her Q is AoE so it's 33% spellvamp effectiveness) as for lifesteal, what it does is increase decently, but i don't think it really means much overall (and depends on the bonus)

However having a flat/scaling Health bonus every 6 AA's is actually decently strong (since AS is basically core, and LS is probably required to make full use of her W) depending on the amount, if it's tiny then it's negligible (2.5 AS still means this doesn't even trigger every 2 seconds) if it's decent sized (think Aatrox sized) then it can be fairly strong if played right (like a heal bait sort of scenario)

Honestly i think she plays like your average Ranged top laner, you win cause your ranged, otherwise she is just an ADC (and honestly a pretty mediocre one)

Also considering that LS is reqiured (i don't think given your ability to use SV and your stuff costing health you can go without LS) her AP ratios kinda get wasted

Could you give me your opinion on her Q and how it works with her W? To be completely honest I've been trying to make a champion that was primarily a mage, building up her W and nuking with her Q, but used her Marksman qualities to be able to stay in lane.

That being said I also wanted to make a champion that was diverse in play style, because honestly it's no fun having a champion that is forced into one purpose.

I'm going to have another look at her AD and passive and I'll update it sometime within the next 24 hours.

The only problem i see with that, is cause her Q is AoE you can't actually do that as your reliant on Life steal to get you through, and that requires both LS and AD.

HOWEVER, this is dependant on if you implement the 6th auto thing and how much it restores, if it Restores enough it can probably cancel out the above need and maybe make her consider building AP/AS.

Maybe even make the heal scale slightly with AP (think Ahri-esque)
